title: Frontiers in Translational Genomics
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Translational Genomics
description: This course covers cutting-edge topics in translational genomics and bioinformatics to train students how to use modern computing and bioinformatics tools to answer biomedical questions in a translational and clinical setting. The topics include single-cell multi-omics and spatiotemporal sequencing, artificial intelligence (AI)-based tools such as deep learning frameworks for multi-modal, multi-omics data integrative analysis, experimental platforms such as ex-vivo models for pre-clinical studies, as well as recent advances in the development of novel diagnostics and therapeutics that leverage the power of genomics and bioinformatics. Ethical issues related to the use of genomics and AI in research and clinical applications will also be discussed.
outcome: Students will be able to: identify and explain the technological importance of genomics and bioinformatics in translational research; describe the analytical and experimental principles of Translational Genomics and its applied fields; apply the principles to address biomedical questions in a translational and clinical setting; compare and relate the selected topics and generate conceptual links between different research fields in order to establish a broader perspective. understand ethical issues, legal requirements and policies related to the use of genomics and AI in research and clinical applications.
syllabus: This is an advanced course on a variety of topics related to translational genomics and bioinformatics, with examples including cutting-edge genomics technologies such as single-cell multi-omics and spatiotemporal sequencing, bioinformatics tools such as deep learning frameworks for multi-modal, multi-omics data integrative analysis, experimental platforms such as ex-vivo models for pre-clinical studies, as well as recent advances in the development of novel diagnostics and therapeutics that leverage the power of genomics and bioinformatics. Ethical issues related to the use of genomics and AI in research and clinical applications will also be discussed.

title: Clinical Genomics
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Translational Genomics
description: This course provides an overview of the clinical applications of genomic approaches to human disorders, particularly in relation to clinical genetics, discussing the methods and capabilities of the new technologies. Students learn how to perform diagnostic analysis of the human genome based on next-generation sequencing (NGS), interpret genomic data when making clinical management decisions, and understand ethical issues, legal requirements, and policies. Applications in prenatal testing and cancer diagnosis will be discussed in detail. Tutorials and hands-on experience in data analysis will be provided, including the interpretation of NGS data.
outcome: ​​​​​​ 了解人類基因組的結構和功能，掌握評估基因組正常或者異常結構與功能的方法與能力。Understand the structure and function of the human genome, and master the methods and abilities to evaluate the normal or abnormal structures and functions of the genome. 了解人體各種遺傳病以及癌症的根本原因，分析患者和家族史以評估遺傳性疾病的易感性。Understand the role of genetics as the underlying causes of various genetic diseases and cancer of the human body, analyze patient and family history to evaluate susceptibility to genetic diseases. 解釋遺傳和環境因素在複雜人類疾病中的作用。Explain the role of genetic & environmental determinants in complex human diseases  描述各種遺傳和基因組檢測之間的差異，以及每種檢測適用的臨床環境與臨床背景。Describe the difference between a variety of genetic and genomic tests, and the clinical context and background within which is appropriate 解釋並應用遺傳和基因組報告以制定合理的臨床建議。Interpret and apply genetic and genomic reports to develop sound clinical recommendations 解釋並評估產前基因篩查和檢測的結果，包括體外授精前基因診斷的應用。Explain the genetic screening and diagnostic testing options within the prenatal context, including the application of preimplantation genetic diagnosis within the IVF setting. 掌握一定的臨床基因組生物信息學分析方法，包括在遺傳病以及癌症中临床檢測，治療以及干預手段相關的知識。Master bioinformatics analysis skills in clinical genomics, including the knowledge related to clinical testing, diagnosis, and treatment of genetic diseases and cancers. 了解並掌握一定的精準醫學與藥物基因組學的相關知識。Understand and master the knowledge of precision medicine and pharmacogenomics. 掌握在醫療保健和研究中使用基因組學的倫理問題、法律要求和機構政策。Understand ethical issues, legal requirements, and institutional policies in the use of genomics in healthcare and research.
syllabus: 這是一門關於臨床基因組學和生物信息學中各種主題的高級課程，包括：This course covers a range of basic topics related to clinical genomics, including: 人類基因組學的診斷和分析的常規和前沿技術（包括1-3代基因組測序等）Conventional and cutting-edge technologies for diagnosis and analysis in human genomics (including 1-3 generation genome sequencing, etc.) 人類遺傳病與癌症等的基因組學內容（遺傳變異，易感基因等等）Genomics underlying human genetic diseases and cancers (genetic variations, susceptible genes, etc.) 基因組學分析在臨床診斷與治療中的應用。The application of genomic analysis in clinical diagnosis and treatment 產前診斷，癌症與遺傳性篩查的基因組學應用。Genomic applications in prenatal testing and cancer diagnosis 基因組學和生信信息學在臨床診斷和治療方案的最新進展。The latest progress in clinical diagnosis and treatment for genomics and bioinformatics 临床基因組學研究与應用的倫理問題、法律要求和機構政策。The ethical issues, legal requirements, and institutional policies in the research and applications of clinical genomes.
